item.title: Teste
item.description: I had been analyzing the data for a while with my friend Cleidson and we always asked ourselves, how to determine the optimal number of clusters for our data? I think this is one of the main questions when working with single-cell data. Although some better known tools like Seurat (R) and Scanpy (Python) have different methods of clustering, they do not return the optimal number of clusters. What I had been doing previously was generating different resolutions with the data and checking with the clustree package in R how the clusters were split from the smallest to the maximum resolution that I had predetermined.
